posts.name: Rick
posts.cooked: Ni says the Rev Robotics Spark Max has been downloaded but it is not showing up in the 3rd Party File? Team 5918 needs help

posts.name: Rick
posts.cooked: Yes, we have restarted Labview and the entire computer.

posts.name: JCharlton
posts.cooked:
Did you install the RevLib from here:

This should install the required VIs under the Third Party folder. image 976×429 24.1 KB

image 976×429 24.1 KB

image 976×429 24.1 KB

posts.name: Rick
posts.cooked: 5918 member here, and yes we have installed Revlib from there and updated the Spark Max Client but still no luck.

posts.name: JCharlton
posts.cooked:
Sorry, not sure what to suggest next. Do you have another computer you can install on and try that? Not a great solution, but if it works, or doesn’t, that might help figure it out.

Good luck!

posts.name: Mark McLeod
posts.cooked:
rlindo:

the Spark Max Client

This may have just been a typo, but you should not have a Spark Max Client . The tool from Rev to setup the Spark Max is now the Rev Hardware Client and that’s what should have been installed.

Did you start from a clean install of LabVIEW, i.e., first deleting all previous versions you may have had on that laptop before installing this year’s code?

posts.name: Rick
posts.cooked: I will check with our programmer, they took the computer home to work on it.  Thanks

posts.name: Rick
posts.cooked: Yes, we have deleted all of the previous versions we had on the computer.

suggested_topics.title: LabView Load Error Code 57
suggested_topics.excerpt: The Snapdragon X Plus is an ARM CPU, which is not compatible with x86 programs like the driver station unfortunately. Windows can emulate x86 programs on ARM but the driver station in particular has S…

suggested_topics.title: Roborio v2025.1.1 and build.gradle is 2025.2.1
suggested_topics.excerpt: Try updating your NI Game tools from NI Package Manager. The latest version should appear in the RIO imaging tool.
